intro: Trigonella elegans, commonly known as the slender fenugreek, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, which is characterized by its legume fruits and nitrogen-fixing abilities. The plant typically grows to a height of about 30–60 cm, with trifoliate leaves and small yellow flowers. Its seeds are used in traditional medicine and as a spice, similar to other members of the fenugreek genus. The botanical features of Trigonella elegans make it an important species in both ecological and agricultural contexts.
